questionText: Former President Jimmy Carter founded the Carter Center.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Transparency for Growth in The Americas is a program for combating corruption through openness in government.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Former President Jimmy Carter has played an active role on the international stage.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Carter has led many international teams of observers to monitor elections throughout the world.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: By 1999 he had monitored more than 20 elections in 16 countries.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Carter has visited 115 countries.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Through the Carter Center, the former President has led successful campaigns against two devastating diseases.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: In 1999 the Center received grants totaling $30 million.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: In August 1999 President Clinton awarded former President Carter the Medal of Freedom.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Carter is credited with gaining release of approximately 50,000 political prisoners.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Jimmy Carter and his wife established the Carter Center in 1982.
author: ANCCKNF1DKRZO

questionText: River blindness is caused by black flies.
author: ANCCKNF1DKRZO

questionText: In 1986, an estimated 3 million people were infested each year with Guinea-worm disease.
author: ANCCKNF1DKRZO

questionText: Trachoma eye disease has blinded 6 million people and infected millions more.
author: ANCCKNF1DKRZO

questionText: The Carter Center recognized Pakistan for being the first Asian nation to eradicate Guinea-worm disease in 2000.
author: ANCCKNF1DKRZO

questionText: Ex-President Jimmy Carter has been a champion for world peace and human rights since leaving office.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Carter has met with various dictators, including Yasser Arafat.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: He and his wife, Rosalynn, established the Carter Center in 1982.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: This center is focused on efforts to ensure free elections and fight several third world diseases.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: In 1998 the Center initiated a project called 'Transparency for Growth in the Americas'.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: The Center is also fighting Guinea-worm disease in Africa and Asia.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: In 1999, the Center initiated its first program aimed at eradicating trachoma.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: In 1982, former US president Jimmy Carter and his wife founded the Carter Center.
author: AJQGWGESKQT4Y

questionText: Carter Center observer missions often include former heads of state.

questionText: Carter has written books on elections and the Middle East.

questionText: Thugs have threatened Carter's life.

questionText: Carter's involvement helped persuade Ortega to accept Nicaraguan election results that deposed him.

questionText: It is responsible for the near global eradication of Guinea worm disease.

questionText: Jimmy Carter was the 39th president of the United States.

questionText: Jimmy Carter's presidency was from 1977-1981.
